intro: Corallodendron breviflorum, commonly known as the short-flowered coral tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant features small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in dense, branching clusters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Corallodendron breviflorum is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
